summary: This is an email chain from October 11, 2019, discussing whether the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York can return the Special Housing Unit cell where Jeffrey Epstein was housed and died to normal use for inmates. The MCC Warden seeks confirmation from the SDNY and OIG investigative team before reopening the cell.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: He was the inmate housed in the Special Housing Unit cell at MCC NY where the incident (his death) occurred.

persons.name: Guido Modano
persons.context: An official with the Office of the Inspector General (OIG) who relays the MCC NY Warden's query about the cell to the investigative team.

events.title: Inquiry about Epstein's cell reuse
events.description: The MCC NY Warden contacts the OIG to ask if the Special Housing Unit cell where Jeffrey Epstein was housed and died can be returned to normal use for inmates.

keyFacts: The email is dated October 11, 2019, shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's death in August 2019.
The MCC NY Warden sought explicit permission from the SDNY and OIG investigative team before reusing the cell where Epstein died.
The cell was located in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.
The document indicates the cell had been secured and kept unoccupied since the incident (Epstein's death).
The SDNY (Southern District of New York) is reported as being 'fine with allowing the cell to go back into normal use.'
